conclusion: For one complete cycle the working substance returns to its initial state, so the change in internal energy is zero (ΔUcycle = 0).
From the first law, the algebraic sum of the heat exchanged with the surroundings during the whole cycle equals the net work done by the gas: Qcycle = Wcycle.
Work done during the four branches.
B → C (isobaric, P = P2): WBC = P2 (V2 – V1).
D → A (isobaric, P = P1): WDA = P1 (V1 – V2) = –P1 (V2 – V1).
Net work for the cycle: Wcycle = WAB + WBC + WCD + WDA = 0 + P2 (V2 – V1) + 0 – P1 (V2 – V1) = (P2 – P1)(V2 – V1).
Because ΔUcycle = 0, the heat absorbed by (or rejected from) the gas in one complete cycle is Qcycle = (P2 – P1)(V2 – V1).
If P2 > P1 and V2 > V1 the quantity is positive, i.e. the gas absorbs that amount of heat from the surroundings and performs an equal amount of work per cycle.
